subject: Mental Health
title: Anticipatory Grief
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Anticipatory Grief.

hook.text: You can grieve someone who hasn't died yet â€” and millions of caregivers do.

buildup.text: Anticipatory grief begins when a terminal diagnosis or progressive decline is expected.

discovery.text: It involves mourning the future that will never happen while the person is still alive.

twist.text: Some caregivers feel guilty for grieving while their loved one is still here.

climax.text: Anticipatory grief can ease the transition after death â€” or intensify it if complicated.

punchline.text: Grieving early isn't giving up. It's loving through the letting go.

quiz.question: What is anticipatory grief?
options: Grieving before a death occurs during expected decline
Grief that happens quickly after death
